newsitem.title: COSTA RICA: Costa Rica coffee whetting appetite of Chinese.
newsitem.headline: Costa Rica coffee whetting appetite of Chinese.

text.p: China is interested in buying Costa Rican coffee and a Beijing diplomatic and trade mission is talking to local coffee authorities, a top coffee official said Tuesday.

"We had a long meeting on Monday with the mission representatives and we explained to them what was going on in the coffee industry," Guillermo Canet, executive director of the Costa Rica Coffee Institute (ICAFE), told Reuters.
But Canet added no deals were immediately struck.
"Lets hope China gets interested in buying, it has great potential," he added.
The Chinese mission is exploring trade openings between the two countries although they have no diplomatic relations.

Canet said Costa Rica does not directly sell coffee to China, one of the world's most-sought-after markets and often seen as the one market producers need to conquer to force prices on a long-term upward trend.
"They are very interested and showed interest in our explanations and showed a desire to keep up contacts once they leave," Canet added.
The 18-member Chinese delegation arrived in san Jose Saturday and, later Tuesday, will fly to Panama.
Canet said the Chinese invited Costa Rica to take part in an agroindustrial exposition in China in 1997.
